body.head: Matthäus Hentz
body.p: Lecturer at the Teacher's College in Heilbronn, acquaintance of August Halm.

div.head: Career Summary
div.p: Matthäus Hentz was a lecturer during the 1920s at the Lehrerseminar (Teachers' College) in Heilbronn, 35 miles (130 kilometers) north of Stuttgart. He was a scientist and mathematician by profession (OJ 11/35, 19). His last post, as regional school superintendent (1928‒51), was in Heidenheim (80 miles east of Stuttgart).

Hentz had no known connection with Schenker, but was associated with one of Schenker's correspondents, August Halm. Letters that Halm received from his friend Theodor Karl Schmid (1876‒1963), a lecturer at the Lehrerseminar in Nagold (35 miles southwest of Stuttgart), indicate that Hentz was skilled enough as an instrumentalist (possibly strings) to play chamber music with Schmid, Halm, and other faculty from schools in the Stuttgart area.
